isis.stitle: Recall 98502 - Sleeper Compartment HVAC on 9200, 9300, 9400, and 9800 Pro Sleeper™ Models

recall.subject: Sleeper Compartment HVAC on 9200, 9300, 9400, and 9800 Pro Sleeper™ Models

defect.para: This Recall applies to 9200, 9300, 9400, and 9800 Pro Sleeper® models. The build dates for the 9000 models Conventional Trucks are from 5/1/97 to 4/1/98 and the build dates for the 9800 Cabovers are 7/1/97 to 5/8/98.

A relay located behind the heater and air conditioner control panel in the bunk of the Pro Sleeper models can corrode in the presence of moisture, which could result in a short circuit between contacts on the relay. This condition could cause a vehicle fire potentially resulting in a personal injury or property damage, or both.

Navistar will notify owners of this campaign. A listing of owner names and addresses will have been furnished to the involved dealers to enable them to follow up with this campaign. You must limit the use of this listing to this campaign since the list may contain information obtained from state motor vehicle registration records and the use of such motor vehicle registration data for purposes other than this campaign is a violation of law in several states.

svcproc.title: HVAC JUMPER HARNESS RETROFIT (STANDARD TEMP. CONTROL)

step1.para: Turn the ignition key to the "Off" position.
Remove (4) screws from the sleeper control panel. Refer to Figure 1.
Pull out panel assembly to expose wiring.
Unplug connector from temperature control switch pigtail. Unplug old jumper harness (3519435C91) with relay, from sleeper harness.
Insert jumper harness 8900065R91 with pigtails with white tape going to sleeper harness and the pigtail with no tape going to temp control switch on the back of the sleeper control panel.

note.para: One of the pigtails on the jumper harness will not be used.

step1.para: Velcro tape is provided on the back of the replacement relay. Position half of the tape on the upper backside of the control panel; mount the replacement relay to tape. New relay must be positioned with the circuits / terminals in the down position. Refer to Figure 2.
Tuck in wiring behind panel and insert control panel into opening.

svcproc.title: HVAC JUMPER HARNESS RETROFIT (AUTO TEMP. CONTROL OPTION)

step1.para: Turn the ignition key to the "Off" position.
Remove (4) screws from the sleeper control panel. Refer to Figure 1.
Pull out panel assembly to expose wiring.
Unplug connector from temperature control switch pigtail. Unplug old jumper harness (3519435C91) with relay from sleeper harness.

Insert jumper harness 8900065R91 with pigtails with white tape going to the sleeper harness, the pigtails with no tape going to auto temperature control switch and the A/C switch on back of the sleeper control panel.

Velcro tape is provided on the back of the replacement relay. Position half of velcro tape on the upper backside of the control panel; mount the replacement relay to tape. New relay must be positioned with the circuits / terminals in the down position. Refer to Figure 2.
Tuck in wiring behind panel and insert control panel into opening.

entry.para: Removal and installation of the HVAC jumper harness

responuscan.para:
Proceed immediately to make necessary correction to units in inventory. All inventory vehicles subject to this recall campaign must be corrected prior to sale, transfer or delivery.
If vehicles have been sold or transferred and you are in receipt of Customer Notification Letters and Authorization for Recall Service cards for those vehicles, transfer location or customer must be notified from your dealer location. Dearlers must correct all vehicles subject to this campaign at no charge to the owner, regardless of mileage, age of vehicle, or ownership, from this time forward.

The National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act, as amended, provides that each vehicle that is subject to a vehicle recall campaign must be adequately repaired within a reasonable time after the owner has tendered it for repair. A failure to adequately repair within 60 days after a tender of a vehicle is prima facie evidence of failure to repair within a reasonable time. If the condition is not adequately repaired within 60 days, the owner may be entitled to replacement with an identical or reasonable equivalent vehicle at no charge, or to a refund of the purchase price less a reasonable allowance for depreciation.

In order to avoid having to replace an owner vehicle or refund the purchase price, every effort must be made to promptly schedule an appointment with each owner to repair his vehicle as soon as possible.
